author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu government has arranged for a number of medical camps to be set up in Kumbakonam ahead of the Mahamaham festival.

The State’s Health Department has set up 138 health camps in and around the Mahamaham temple tank. The health camps which were set up on February 13 and will function till February 23 will work round-the-clock, a government release said.

Also, 34 “ 108 ambulances” and 11 bike ambulances have been stationed around the temple tank while 104 free medical help centres will be available for pilgrims, the release said. The government has stationed six deputy directors to monitor water quality during the festival and 102 officers to monitor food quality, the release said and added that 2,472 Health Department officials have been deputed for the festival.
title: Ambulances, medical camps for Mahamaham
